title: Digital Transformation Lead
description:
*BROMMA is a division of Kalmar, operating under its own brand. BROMMA has been the leading manufacturer of crane spreaders ever since its formation in the 1960s. Today we have, by far, the highest market share of the world’s spreader suppliers. Today, our spreaders are currently in use in 99 of the top-100 ports worldwide.*

 *BROMMA sales and service network has a wide-reaching footprint. We are present with own sales offices on all continents, and with an extensive network of agents, we are able to support customers in every country in the world.*  

  

*More information about BROMMA can be found on* *www.bromma.com*

**Join us and take your career to the next level**
--------------------------------------------------

  

We are looking for a Digital Transformation Lead to join our team in Kista and play a pivotal role in shaping Bromma’s digital future. In this role, you will define and execute our digital strategy, ensuring that we remain at the forefront of the cargo handling industry through practical, scalable, and business-driven technology. This is not a purely strategic role — you will turn vision into action. You will lead the implementation of Bromma’s digital roadmap, take hands-on responsibility for the technical setup and development of our Information Management (IM) systems, and drive transformation initiatives from concept to execution.

  

Reporting to the Director Digitalisation and Sustainability, you will operate with a high degree of autonomy while collaborating closely with external partners and teams across the organization. Your focus will be on shaping sustainable, forward-looking solutions that support how we work today and position us for the future.

**What are your key responsibilities:**
---------------------------------------

  

As the Digital Transformation Lead at Bromma, you will work closely with internal stakeholders and external vendors to:

* **Manage and deliver IT projects**, overseeing the full cycle from implementing new capabilities to the continuous development and upgrading of existing applications.
* **Drive our data and analytics strategy** through hands-on development, specifically building out new capabilities within the Google Cloud Platform (e.g., Data Studio and Connected Sheets).
* **Refine and build data models** to ensure better integration and smoother data flow across our global platforms and business processes.
* **Implement and optimize AI-driven tools**, focusing on practical applications that improve our day-to-day business operations.
* **Play a key role in major technology transitions**, including our global ERP modernization and the enhancement of service delivery tools and processes.
* **Develop and maintain Bromma’s IM architecture**, ensuring a cohesive and functional strategy across our entire digital landscape.
* **Work across a diverse technology stack** with systems like SAP, Salesforce, Tacton CPQ, and Hybris eCommerce to solve technical and business challenges.
**What we offer you:**
----------------------

 *"Respect is how we work — across departments, across borders, across job titles."*

* **Rewards that truly count**: We create opportunities for growth through diverse experiences and uphold fair, gender-neutral pay, fostering a culture built on equity, empowerment, and continuous development. We also offer a comprehensive rewards package which combines flexibility, wellness, and recognition.
* **Safety that moves us forward**: Build your career with a company rooted in safety since the 1940s, ensuring stability and an environment that empowers you to speak and be heard.
* **Purpose that drives change**: You'll contribute to solutions that transform global trade, creating environmental and operational innovations. You'll be in the driver's seat of ideas, developing digital technologies that set industry standards and position us as the forerunner.
* **People who move together**: You'll collaborate with people who build lasting relationships through global expertise, connections, and a commitment to sustainability.

  

Become part of our global network of 5,300 professionals across 120+ countries, where your work drives innovation, sustainability, and meaningful impact around the world.

**What you bring to the role:**
-------------------------------

  

We are looking for a pragmatic professional who enjoys the intersection of strategy and execution. To thrive in this role, you will have:

* **Proven Digital Leadership:** Significant experience driving digital transformation projects within large, international enterprise environments.
* **Project Management Expertise:** A solid track record of managing IT projects from start to finish, with the ability to navigate both Waterfall and Agile delivery methods.
* **Technical Breadth:** Broad expertise in enterprise applications and a deep understanding of how they integrate to support business goals.
* **Hands-on Analytics Skills:** Practical experience in analytics development, particularly within Google Cloud Platform (Data Studio, Connected Sheets) and the wider Google Workspace ecosystem.
* **Architectural Mindset:** Extensive experience in Information Management (IM) architecture and the ability to translate digitalization strategy into functional reality.
* **Navigating Complexity:** Experience working within complex IT ecosystems, ideally in an industrial or manufacturing setting, with an understanding of how digital tools support physical operations.
* **Strong educational Foundation:** B.Sc or M.Sc degree preferably in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
* **Language Skills:** Fluency in **English** is essential as it is our corporate language. Proficiency in **Swedish** is considered a strong asset.
**Ready to elevate your career? Apply today!**
----------------------------------------------

  

Join us and take the next step in your career journey with Bromma! As the interviews may begin before the closing date, we encourage early applications. Please submit your CV in English.

  

We support hybrid work arrangements, offering flexibility to balance office and remote work but don’t provide relocation support.

  

For more information on the role, please contact Joakim Heijbel, Director Digitalisation and Sustainability, via email: joakim.heijbel@bromma.com.

  

Closing Date: 15/3/2026

  

#LI-Hybrid #Bromma

 *Bromma is part of Kalmar.*

***About Kalmar***

 *Kalmar (Nasdaq Helsinki: KALMAR) is moving goods in critical supply chains around the world, with the vision to be the forerunner in sustainable material handling equipment and services. The company offers a wide range of industry shaping heavy material handling equipment and services to ports and terminals, distribution centres, manufacturing and heavy logistics. Headquartered in Helsinki, Finland, Kalmar operates globally in over 120 countries and employs approximately 5,300 people. In 2025, the company's sales totalled approximately EUR 1.7 billion.* *www.kalmarglobal.com*
company_description: Kalmar is the industry forerunner in terminal automation and in energy efficient container handling, with one in four container movements around the globe being handled by a Kalmar solution.

title: Salesforce & Commercial Insights Specialist - Varnish Software
description:
### **About Varnish Software**


Varnish Software is a Scandinavian-based tech company developing caching technology for some of the world's biggest players in the content delivery market. Our technology helps businesses worldwide improve website performance, deliver video streams, and scale their infrastructure.

### **The Role**


The Salesforce & Commercial Insights Specialist is a hybrid role that combines deep technical ownership of Salesforce with a growing analytical and strategic advisory function. You will be responsible for ensuring the health, scalability, and usability of our Salesforce ecosystem, while also supporting the commercial team with deal-level profitability analysis, business area insights, and pricing intelligence.


This is an individual contributor role for someone who is not just an administrator, but a business-minded system owner ready to help Varnish Software take our data-driven go-to-market execution to the next level.

### **Key Responsibilities**

#### **Salesforce Ownership**

* Own the end-to-end administration, customization, and performance of Salesforce across the business and ensure an efficient sales process are fully supported and up to date
* Maintain and optimize automation, object/field structure, user roles, permission sets, screen flows, and integrations (e.g., HubSpot, GetAccept, Chorus, ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator).
* Proactively test, implement, and document Salesforce releases and updates.
* Serve as the go-to expert for Salesforce usability and troubleshooting across departments.
* Ensure data integrity through cleansing, deduplication, and system audits.
* Manage and secure user provisioning, backups, and application integrations.

**Commercial & Deal Analytics**

* Follow up on relevant sales related KPI’s to support Sales managers and for our business to succeed.
* Build and deliver dashboards and reports that track performance by deal, customer, region, and product area.
* Design and implement (in Salesforce) price calculators for different solutions, where applicable.
* Provide structured profitability tracking at the deal and customer level—highlighting trends, anomalies, and commercial risks.
* Collaborate with the CFO and the sales team to bring transparency to contribution margins and pricing effectiveness.
* Partner with Sales leadership and individual Sales Execs and Account Excecs, on pipeline management, KPS and support on pricing.

#### **Strategic & Cross-Functional Support**

* Act as a commercial advisor to Sales and Finance, capable of analyzing data and presenting clear conclusions with recommended actions.
* Support the development and implementation of pricing strategies and automation of quoting workflows.
* Provide Salesforce reports for monthly business reviews and board reporting.
* Maintain and improve the commission logic setup in Salesforce and serve as technical liaison for Spiff or other tools.

### **Key Qualifications**

* 3–5 years of experience in Salesforce administration, revenue operations, or commercial analytics preferable in a SaaS environment.
* Proven expertise in Salesforce administration, including automation, integrations, and system architecture and strong understanding of Salesforce best practice.
* Salesforce Admin (ADM201 and ADM2011) certified and Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and Developer certification preferred.
* Strong understanding of the platform, with the ability to build custom dashboards, objects, formula fields, workflows, custom views, and other content above intermediate complexity.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to draw insights and present actionable recommendations to stakeholders.
* Experience with deal profitability tracking, contribution margin reporting, or commercial business control
* Familiarity with tools such as HubSpot, GetAccept, Spiff, ZoomInfo, and LinkedIn Sales Navigator.
* Fluent in English (written and spoken); additional languages a plus.

### **Personal Characteristics**

* Technically curious, commercially minded, and highly structured.
* Confident communicator who can translate data into compelling business stories.
* Reliable, proactive, and capable of operating independently while coordinating with multiple teams.
* Ambitious and eager to grow into broader commercial, operational, or leadership responsibilities over time.

**Ready to join our team?** We look forward to learning more about you and how you can contribute to our success.

title: FullStack Back End Engineer
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 The Merchant Group consists of 150+ engineers across 25+ cross-functional teams, working together to help merchants grow their businesses and streamline operations through innovative technology. Some of us focus on building seamless experiences for our merchants, while others work on the behind-the-scenes magic that makes everything run smoothly.
   

  

 We’re looking for a
 **backend-leaning Fullstack Engineer** 
 to help build and evolve the
 **next generation of merchant tooling** 
 , with a focus on
 **inventory management and warehousing** 
 for
 **Wolt Markets and other merchant partners** 
 . If you’re passionate about creating reliable, user-friendly systems that support thousands of merchants and millions of customers, we’d love to have you join us in
 **Helsinki, Finland or Stockholm, Sweden** 
 . Read more about our hybrid setup
 **here** 
 .
   

  

 Feel free to check out the
 **Wolt Tech Blog** 
 for more insight into our culture and technology.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

 As an engineer in our group, you’ll work on production systems that support merchant and warehouse operations, contributing
 **across the stack with a primary focus on backend development** 
 . You’ll help shape how inventory and merchant tools work at scale, while also building user-facing interfaces used daily by store managers.
   

  

**Day-to-day in this role you’ll:**
* Design, build, and maintain backend services using Kotlin (and occasionally Scala), supporting core merchant and inventory workflows.
* Contribute to full-stack features, including developing and improving React + TypeScript frontend applications.
* Work across the development lifecycle — from implementation and testing to deployment and monitoring in the cloud.
* Collaborate with teammates on system and API design, making pragmatic technology choices that keep our systems reliable and easy to evolve.
* Partner closely with product managers and designers to turn operational needs into clear, user-friendly solutions.
* Learn and grow alongside experienced engineers in an environment that values curiosity, knowledge sharing, and continuous improvement.


 Our humble expectations
   

  

 We’re seeking experienced Software Engineers with a strong background in building scalable microservices. While Kotlin is our primary language, experience with Java, Scala, or other JVM backend languages is great. As we are exploring Go, we're looking for people who are confident in their ability to learn and teach! 🛠️
   

  

 Beyond technical expertise, we value ownership, collaboration, and a mindset for growth. We think you're a great communicator who thrives in tackling complex challenges, questioning conventions, and working closely with teammates to build reliable, scalable systems. 🚀
   

  

**To be successful in this role, it helps if you have:**
* Strong backend experience, with Kotlin (or other JVM languages) as your primary focus.
* Practical experience building frontend applications with React, and comfort contributing to UI code when needed.
* Experience switching between backend and frontend work, even if backend is where you spend most of your time.
* Familiarity with testing, CI/CD pipelines, and deploying services to cloud environments.
* A collaborative mindset, clear communication skills, and an interest in learning from and with others.


 How We Work
   

  

**Autonomy & Ownership** 
 – Our engineers have end-to-end responsibility for their services, from implementation to production.
   

  

**Collaboration** 
 – Architecture and working methods are defined together, ensuring we make the best choices for long-term success.
   

  

**Scalability & Simplicity** 
 – We value pragmatic solutions that keep our systems robust without unnecessary complexity. We use technologies that serve Wolt, our teams, and our engineers best. You’ll have the freedom to experiment and adopt the tools that work.
   

  

 Next steps
   

  

 We are continuously reviewing applications, so don’t hesitate to apply today - you will hear back from us as soon as possible.
   

  

 You can read more about our recruitment process here.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Senior Software Tester (embedded systems)
description:
**About Munters**
 Munters is a global leader in energy-efficient solutions for industrial environments. With our innovative technologies, we create sustainable climate solutions that optimize performance, safety, and reliability in demanding industrial processes. Our products are used worldwide across a wide range of sectors, from manufacturing and data centers to agricultural applications. At Munters, we combine technical expertise with a strong focus on quality, innovation, and sustainability.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Are you ready to take on a technical leadership role in the development of sustainable climate solutions? We are looking for a
 **Senior Software Tester (embedded systems)** 
 to join our development team in Kista. This role is ideal for someone who wants to combine deep technical knowledge with advanced quality assurance and coaching of colleagues.
   

  

 As a Senior Software Tester, you will be responsible for the test strategy, test design, and quality assurance of our embedded control systems. You will lead testing activities, mentor junior testers, and work closely with software and hardware engineers, designers, Product Owners, and Product Managers. You will be a strong advocate for quality throughout the development lifecycle and contribute to implementing automated tests and consistent testing practices across the team.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and refine the test strategy and test planning for embedded systems
* Collaborate with software testers and developers to expand and improve test automation and testing strategies
* Execute test cases, analyze results, and clearly document findings
* Design and execute advanced system tests (both manual and automated)
* Develop test environments and tools for hardware-near testing
* Troubleshoot and analyze complex system failures
* Ensure testability during the design phase through requirements review and technical guidance
* Lead and support junior testers
* Collaborate with development, product management, and quality teams to ensure quality throughout the development lifecycle
* Report test results, risks, and improvement suggestions to stakeholders


**Your Profile**
* Minimum 7 years of experience in system testing within embedded systems
* Deep knowledge of RTOS, microcontrollers, embedded Linux, and communication protocols (e.g., Modbus, I2C)
* Experience in test automation using tools such as Python, Robot Framework, or similar
* Strong understanding of hardware-near development and troubleshooting
* Experience with CI/CD and version control (e.g., Git, Jenkins, Azure DevOps)
* Strong understanding and experience working according to SCRUM
* Experience designing and executing test plans and test cases
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills in English


**Nice To Have**
* Experience with climate control systems or industrial control systems
* Knowledge of IoT/cloud-related technologies such as gateways, MQTT, and Protobuf
* Programming skills in C/C++
* Familiarity with electrical cabinets and wiring according to applicable safety regulations


**Soft Skills**
* Strong team player with a collaborative mindset
* Comfortable working in a dynamic environment with evolving processes
* High level of initiative and strong problem-solving ability — able to take ownership and move tasks forward independently as well as in a team
* Strong strategic and analytical skills
* Committed to quality and technical excellence
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, essential for a cross-functional, global development environment
* Proactive and solution-oriented, with a drive to improve and streamline testing practices
* Enjoys sharing knowledge and collaborating with colleagues to achieve common goals


**What We Offer**
* A key role in a growing, strategically important team
* An international and innovative work environment
* 4 days in the office and 1 day of home office
* A company culture that values precision, ownership, and collaboration
* Competitive salary and benefits package
* Opportunities for personal and professional development


**Ready to ensure the highest quality in Munters’ embedded systems?**
 Then don’t wait—send in your application today, and who knows, we may soon welcome you to our team!
   

  

 Would you like more information or do you have any questions?
   

  

 Feel free to contact Yannick Voet, our Talent Acquisition Specialist:
   

  

 yannick.voet@munters.com
   

  

 +32 (4)86 93 89 11
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Chief Technology Officer
description:
Chief Technology Officer (CTO)
 **Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid)** 




  





 Enertek Group is partnering with a well-established
 **financial services organisation in Stockholm** 
 that is continuing to invest in its
 **technology, data, and AI capabilities** 
 to support both innovation and long-term scalability.
 



  





 As part of this growth, they are seeking a
 **Chief Technology Officer (CTO)** 
 to take ownership of the
 **technology vision, architecture, and delivery strategy** 
 , ensuring the company’s platforms are secure, resilient, and aligned with commercial and regulatory requirements.
 



  





 The opportunity:
 



 This is a senior leadership role with responsibility for turning technology into a
 **strategic enabler of the business** 
 . You will work closely with the executive team to shape priorities, guide investment decisions, and ensure technology supports both current operations and future growth.
 



  





 Key responsibilities:
 


* Define and execute the
 **technology strategy and roadmap**
* Lead architecture across
 **cloud, data, and AI/ML platforms**
* Build and develop high-performing
 **engineering and data teams**
* Drive modern
 **DevOps and MLOps practices**
* Own
 **cybersecurity, platform resilience, and regulatory compliance**
* Partner with senior stakeholders to translate business goals into technical outcomes



  





 Experience required:
 


* Senior technology leadership experience (CTO, VP Engineering, or Head of Technology)
* Strong background in
 **software engineering and cloud architecture**
* Experience operating in
 **financial services, fintech, or other regulated environments**
* Proven ability to lead teams, manage complexity, and deliver at scale



  





 What’s on offer:
 


* Executive role with meaningful influence on company direction
* Competitive salary, benefits, and long-term growth potential
* Hybrid working model based in
 **Stockholm**



  





 If you’re a technology leader looking for a role where you can
 **shape strategy, lead teams, and deliver real impact** 
 , we would welcome a confidential conversation.

title: CPO — AI & Workflow Platform
description:
We are a
 **Nordic Value-Added Reseller and solutions company** 
 specializing in B2B SaaS. We sell, implement, and support enterprise tools across ITSM, CRM, customer support, and work management — serving 100+ customers with strong recurring revenue.
 



  





 We are now investing in building proprietary AI-powered products on top of this foundation. This role exists to lead that effort.
 



  





 This is a
 **senior leadership role** 
 with direct ownership of product strategy, technology architecture, and engineering execution. You will report to the CEO and operate with significant autonomy.
 



  





 We are not looking for someone to maintain existing systems. We are looking for someone to build new ones — from first principles, with real customers, and with a clear path to scalable IP.
 



  





**What you’ll own:** 



* Product + technology strategy: customer needs → roadmap → execution
* An AI-first workflow platform (orchestration, integrations, approvals, auditability)
* A strong shipping loop: prototype → measure → improve (evals, monitoring, cost control)
* Team building over time: hiring, standards, pace, and culture



  





**Customer-facing: consulting + delivery:** 




 You’ll work directly with customers—sometimes hands-on—to:
 


* Run discovery workshops and translate processes into automation designs
* Advise on adoption, governance, and change management
* Deliver solutions that create value quickly and reliably



  





**IP mindset: build with partners, own what matters** 




 We expect you to be excellent at both:
 


* **Building IP on top of third-party platforms** 
 (LLMs, cloud services, automation suites, partner products) to move fast and package repeatable value, and
* **Building our own proprietary IP** 
 where it differentiates us (workflow logic, domain models, agent behaviors, evaluation & reliability layer, UX patterns, connectors).



 You should have strong judgement about what to buy/partner for vs. what to build and protect.
 



  





**The kind of person who thrives here:** 



* **Prestigeless and practical** 
 : you care about results, not titles, hype, or status
* You’ve shipped production AI (LLMs/agents/RAG/evals) and understand reliability, security, and cost
* You can switch between strategy and hands-on execution when needed
* You’re
 **commercial** 
 : you understand ROI, customer value, and how good product supports sales
* You like building in ambiguity, with high autonomy and high accountability



  





**Bonus points:** 



* Experience in VAR / solutions environments and packaging services into product
* Experience with
 **ITSM** 
 and service workflows (incident, request, problem, change)
* Integrations across Microsoft 365, Google Workspace, Slack, CRM/ERP
* Multi-tenant SaaS, security/compliance patterns, enterprise delivery



  





**Apply:** 




 Send a short note with:
 


1. an AI product/solution you shipped (what you owned + outcomes),
2. an example of a workflow you automated end-to-end,
3. how you think about building IP on top of third-party platforms vs owning core IP.



  





 We review applications and conduct interviews on an ongoing basis and will fill the position as soon as the right candidate is identified

title: Cloud Sales Advisor
description:
Acronis is a world leader in cyber protection, delivering natively integrated solutions that monitor, control, and protect the data that businesses and lives depend on. Driven by our passion to protect every workload, we’ve built the industry’s only all-in-one cyber protection platform.
   

  

 Our next big growth campaign for 2026 is underway. We are looking for relentless, high-energy Cloud Sales Advisors to ignite new business across the Managed Service Provider (MSP) ecosystem.
   

  

 If you thrive on the hunt, love turning conversations into conversions, and get fired up by building pipeline, this is your moment.
   

  

**What You’ll Drive**
* Hunt, identify, and win new MSP partners ready to scale their cloud offerings
* Build strong, value-led relationships from first outreach to contract close
* Lead dynamic sales conversations that educate, excite, and convert
* Craft tailored cloud solutions that solve real MSP challenges
* Work closely with Partner Success, Product & Marketing to deliver seamless onboarding
* Keep your finger on the pulse of cloud trends, competitor moves, and market shifts
* Hit — and exceed — ambitious campaign growth targets


**What Makes You The Perfect Fit**
* You’re a natural hunter who lives for new business and thrives on the chase
* Proven experience in cloud sales, tech sales, or MSP-focused roles
* Confident communicator — persuasive, energetic, and consultative
* Ability to speak the language of MSPs: margins, service stacks, automation, recurring revenue
* You’re proactive, competitive, and motivated by results
* High energy, high urgency, high impact — every day


**What You’ll Get**
* Working for a high-growth, company with investment backing
* Control of your pipeline and the freedom to bring your sales style to life
* A collaborative team that has your back and celebrates big wins
* Competitive compensation, accelerators, and growth opportunities
* The chance to make a visible impact in the MSP channel
* Please submit your CV and application in English.


**Who We Are**
 Acronis is revolutionizing cyber protection by unifying backup, disaster recovery, storage, next-generation anti-malware, and protection management into one solution. This all-in-one integration removes the complexity and risks associated with non-integrated solutions and offers easy, complete and reliable data protection for all workloads, applications, and systems across any environment—all at a low and predictable cost.
   

  

 Founded in Singapore in 2003 and incorporated in Switzerland in 2008, Acronis now has more than 2,000 employees and offices in 34 locations worldwide. Its solutions are trusted by more than 5.5 million home users and 500,000 companies, and top-tier professional sports teams. Acronis products are available through over 50,000 partners and service providers in over 150 countries and 26 languages.
   

  

 Our corporate culture is focused on making a positive impact on the lives of each employee and the communities in which we live. Mutual trust, respect, personal achievement, individual leadership, and a belief that we can contribute to the world everyday are the cornerstones of the Acronis Team.
   

  

*Acronis is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.*
**Our Interview Practices**
 To maintain a fair and genuine hiring process, we kindly ask that all candidates participate in interviews without the assistance of AI tools or external prompts. Our interview process is designed to assess your individual skills, experiences, and communication style. We value authenticity and want to ensure we’re getting to know you—not a digital assistant. To help maintain this integrity, we ask to remove virtual backgrounds and include in-person interviews in our hiring process.
   

  

 Use of AI-generated responses or third-party support during live interviews may be grounds for disqualification from the recruitment process and a full criminal, education and identification background check is required for all new hires.

title: Technical Account Manager, Google Cloud Consulting
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience in a customer-facing role working with stakeholders, driving customer technical implementations or transformation programs.
* Experience supporting customers in cloud operations (e.g., launch or capacity planning, product release management), technical support, escalation management, or IT consulting.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* MBA or Master’s degree in a Management, Technical, or Engineering field.
* Experience translating business requirements into technological solutions.
* Experience in application or workload migration to public cloud providers.
* Experience collaborating with teams, groups, business units, channel partners, systems integrators, and third-party developers to deliver solutions.
* Understanding of IT operations, database systems, networking, IT security, application development, service architecture, cloud-native application development, hosted services, storage systems, or content delivery networks.
* Ability to communicate in English and Swedish fluently to support client relationship management in this region.


**About the job** 
 Our Google Cloud Consulting organization within Google Cloud delivers product and implementation expertise to our customers to help them get the most out of their Google Cloud investments.
   

  

 As a Technical Account Manager (TAM), you will help customers successfully adopt Google Cloud products. Your previous experience with cloud infrastructure, program management, enterprise technology implementation, strategy development, and customer advocacy will play a critical part in your day-to-day work by driving success at our most critical customers. You will lead the successful adoption of Google Cloud at leading organizations, guiding them through the technical facets of their Cloud transformation journey.
   

  

 In this role, you will drive customer adoption of Google Cloud services like Google Compute Engine, Vertex AI, Google Kubernetes Engine, BigQuery, and many more. You will regularly engage with stakeholder groups, including executives of large enterprises and a cross-functional and geographically dispersed team. You will utilize relationship management skills and technical credibility to effectively communicate at all levels of the organization, establishing yourself as a trusted advisor.
   

  

 You will travel (domestically and internationally) up to approximately 20% of the time as needed.
   

  

 Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Accelerate customer adoption of Google Cloud by leading the implementation journey. Provide technical guidance and manage timelines, milestones, migration goals, and business transformation strategies.
* Advocate for customer needs in order to overcome adoption blockers and drive new feature development. Lead across multiple workstreams and teams to maintain customer momentum.
* Develop relationships with stakeholders to understand customer’s business, develop roadmaps, and lead quarterly business reviews and executive sessions to better understand business and technical needs.
* Plan for customer events and launches, partnering with support, engineers, and site reliability engineers to ensure customer success, and work with customers and support to guide issues/escalations to resolution.
* Develop best practices and assets based on learnings from customer engagements to support initiatives to scale through partners and accelerate Google Cloud adoption.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
Vi står inför en spännande fas där vi
 **tar vår plattform in i molnet (AWS)** 
 och nu söker vi en
 **AWS Cloud Engineer** 
 som vill vara med och bygga en stabil, säker och skalbar driftsmiljö.
   

  

 Det här är en nyckelroll där du får kombinera teknik, struktur och utvecklarstöd och vara med och forma hur vi bygger framtidens infrastruktur på Kleer.
   

  

 Kleer är ekonomi- och lönehantering för moderna SaaS- och konsultbolag. Vi kombinerar Sveriges mest automatiserade ekonomisystem med ett dedikerat ekonomiteam. Resultatet: finansiell kontroll i realtid, minimal administration och en ekonomi som driver affären – inte bara rapporterar om den.
   

  

 Vi har utsetts till DI Gasell sju gånger och är stolta över vår värderingsstyrda kultur som bygger på ansvar, glädje, nyfikenhet och prestigelöshet. Idag är vi cirka 200 medarbetare med kontor i centrala Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområden**
* Vara med och bygga upp och vidareutveckla vår AWS-miljö med fokus på stabilitet, säkerhet och skalbarhet
* Säkerställa bra grundförutsättningar för driftsättning och stabil drift i AWS
* Arbeta med Kubernetes som en central del i vår plattform
* Driva automationsarbete och standardisering med Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
* Stötta utvecklingsteamen i moln-relaterade frågor kring deployment, access, nätverk och drift
* Förbättra observabilitet: loggning, monitorering, larm och incidentberedskap
* Bidra till kunskapsdelning, dokumentation och arbetssätt som gör oss snabbare och tryggare


**Vem är du?**
**Vi Tror Att Du Har**
* God förståelse för AWS och hur man bygger stabila molnmiljöer över tid
* Erfarenhet av Kubernetes i drift och förvaltning
* Praktisk erfarenhet av IaC-verktyg som Terraform eller CloudFormation
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-verktyg (primärt GitLab)
* God förståelse för nätverk, containerisering (Docker) och orkestrering (Kubernetes)
* Kunskap om säkerhetsprinciper i molnet och erfarenhet av att implementera säkerhetskontroller
* Van att arbeta med övervakning och observabilitets-verktyg (t.ex. Prometheus, Grafana, CloudWatch)
* Förmåga att skapa struktur, standarder och hållbara lösningar
* Trivs med att jobba i team och kommunicera med olika delar av organisationen.


 Meriterande är erfarenhet av kostnadsstyrning i molnet och tidigare deltagande i större migreringsprojekt. Det är en fördel om man jobbat i en Java-värld tidigare men det går bra att även ha jobbat i andra miljöer.
   

  

 🚀AI som en naturlig del av vardagen
   

  

 På Kleer tror vi att framtidens team använder AI för att bli både snabbare och bättre.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du gillar att använda AI i ditt arbete – exempelvis för att:
   

  

* felsöka och analysera incidenter snabbare
* skapa bättre dokumentation och effektivare onboarding
* automatisera repetitiva moment och förbättra driftbarhet
* få stöd i designval och tekniska resonemang


 Du behöver inte vara “AI-expert”, men du är nyfiken och ser värdet av att jobba AI-stöttat.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
* En viktig roll i ett snabbväxande bolag med stark kultur och höga ambitioner
* Ett tight teknikteam med hög samarbetsgrad och fokus på lärande
* Flexibla arbetstider, möjlighet till hybridarbete och balans mellan arbete & fritid
* Förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension, föräldralön och kompetensutveckling
* Ett modernt kontor i centrala Stockholm med gym, frukt och sociala aktiviteter


 📍
 **Ort:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

 📅
 **Start:** 
 Omgående, med hänsyn till uppsägningstid
   

  

 ⏳
 **Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
   

  

 Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller i slutskedet av rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 👉 Urval och intervjuer kommer att påbörjas löpande, så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Kleer är ekonomi- och lönehantering för moderna SaaS- och konsultbolag. Vi kombinerar Sveriges mest automatiserade ekonomisystem med ett dedikerat ekonomiteam. Resultatet: finansiell kontroll i realtid, minimal administration och en ekonomi som driver affären – inte bara rapporterar om den.
   

  

 Vi har utsetts till DI Gasell sju gånger och är stolta över vår värderingsstyrda kultur som bygger på ansvar, glädje, nyfikenhet och prestigelöshet. Idag är vi cirka 200 medarbetare med kontor i centrala Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö.

title: Project Completions Manager
description:
**Description**


**The Opportunity**


HVDC (High Voltage Direct Current) is a product group in Hitachi Energy, which develops, manufactures and sells DC transmission systems on a global market. HVDC technology is used to transmit electricity over long distances and for power transmission via submarine cables. It is also used to connect power systems.


We are now hiring a Completion Manager to HVDC Sweden, a business line within Hitachi Energy. As Completions Manager you have a key role in the project by being responsible to define and implement the Project Completion Strategy. You will have the opportunity to work both operational and strategic, as well as interacting with different internal and external stakeholders within the business.


We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even though you don’t meet all requirements. A team with great cooperation and with diverse backgrounds is waiting for you to join!

**How you’ll make an impact**

* Provide leadership, guidance and support in the projects to set up the completion strategy and ensure adherence to completion requirements based on the customer’s contract
* Lead, develop and sustain the completion processes within the project
* Identify the completion activities for the project and coordinate and manage the activities towards the time schedule and different contractual milestones
* Review, train and provide tool clarification on the project completion tool (PCS) to the organization and clarify interfaces
* Set up, govern and maintain inspection and resource plan for inspections at suppliers
* Set-up Project Completion System (PCS) and follow-up by defining the structure of the project by breaking down the scope in systems, subsystems, commissioning packages and mechanical completion packages as defined in the Project Completion Strategy

**Your background**

* Technical / Engineering / Quality management education – preferably bachelor’s degree
* Minimum 5+ years professional experience, and/or completion of at least one major project up to handover to the Customer, in a role related to the function within an EPC in Power, Energy or Oil & Gas project(s)
* Knowledge and experience of working with a Project Completions Systems (PCS) such as PIMS and ProCoSys, or alternatively another similar inspection management software e.g., BIM 360 Field, Aconex Field, etc.
* Proficient oral and written communication skills including technical documentation and reporting
* Sensitive to Customer and project team needs and can develop a sustainable relationship to all involved stakeholders through clear communication, influencing and coordination.
* English fluency (written + spoken)

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**


Are you ready for a new exciting challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Welcome to apply! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!


Recruiting Manager Daniel Martinez, daniel.martinez@hitachienergy.com will be happy to answer your questions regarding this position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43. All other questions should be directed to Talent Partner Michael Blomberg Michael.blomberg@hitachienergy.com

title: Manager Project and Parts
description:
**Description**


**The Opportunity**  

  

The Manager Project and Parts will be responsible for overseeing the successful planning, execution, and delivery of complex projects, with a strong focus on managing the procurement, inventory, and distribution of critical parts and components essential to project success. This role requires a strategic thinker with excellent leadership and organizational skills to ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards, while optimizing the parts supply chain.  

  

**How you´ll make an impact**  

  

* Lead and manage the entire lifecycle of assigned projects, from initiation and planning to execution, monitoring, control, and closure, ensuring adherence to Hitachi's methodologies and standards.
* Develop comprehensive project plans, including scope, objectives, deliverables, timelines, resource allocation, and budget.
* Establish and maintain strong relationships with suppliers and vendors, negotiating contracts and ensuring quality and cost-effectiveness of parts.
* Implement and optimize parts inventory management systems and processes to minimize stockouts, reduce waste, and improve efficiency.
* Monitor project progress, identify potential risks and issues, and develop mitigation strategies to keep projects on track.
* Manage project budgets, track expenses, and ensure financial targets are met.
* Communicate project status, challenges, and successes to stakeholders, including senior management, team members, and clients.
* Lead, mentor, and motivate project teams, fostering a collaborative and high-performance environment.
* Ensure all project activities comply with relevant safety, quality, and regulatory standards.
* Continuously seek opportunities for process improvement within both project management and parts management functions.

  

**Your Background**  

  

* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field. A Master's degree or PMP certification is a strong plus.
* At least a couple of years of progressive experience in project management, with a significant focus on managing parts, materials, or supply chain in a manufacturing, engineering, or technology-driven environment.
* Proven track record of successfully leading and delivering complex projects on time and within budget.
* Proficiency in project management software (e.g., Microsoft Project, Jira) and ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle).
* Excellent leadership, communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail.
* Familiarity with quality management systems (e.g., ISO) and industry-specific regulations.
* Ability to travel as required for project needs.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.

**What We Offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career opportunities within Hitachi Energy, both in Sweden and globally
* A dedicated mentor to support you throughout your onboarding phase
* Various trainings and educational programs supporting your professional development
* A diverse company with more than 70 nationalities represented in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation during parental leave
* Access to an Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks
* Additional benefits may be connected to this specific role

title: Acoustic Engineer
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**

  

Do you want to enable the green energy transition, and together with colleagues meet the world’s needs for sustainable, flexible and insecure energy?


In your work you will be part of HVDC (High Voltage Direct Current) business unit that is a part of Hitachi Energy’s division. The main HVDC office is in Ludvika, but for the right candidate the Västerås office may be an option. The unit develops, manufactures and sells DC transmission systems on a global market. Hitachi Energy’s developed HVDC technology is used to transmit electricity over long distances and for power transmission via submarine cables, thus enabling stability cooperation between grids, sea-based wind power and more.


Are you interested in combining acoustic analysis with high voltage (hundreds of kV) and high power (GW) topics together with common sense? You will be analysing noise propagation, suggesting and specifying mitigations on equipment and plant level and supporting the organization in the acoustic area as well as maintaining an overall plant perspective in large scale projects, all in a highly international environment. Then maybe you should consider becoming part of our team at HVDC!

 **How you’ll make an impact**

  

* Evaluating acoustics through calculations, modelling and 3D simulations of noise propagation.
* Perform on site measurements to verify calculations and fulfillment of requirements
* You will be working in a multidisciplinary technical environment where mechanical, climate and electrical considerations are necessary as well as cost and quality.
* Convert theoretical results into reality in actual design suggestions in cooperation with equipment and civil construction responsible.
* Be part of constant improvement activities to make sure we stay competitive also for the future.
* Interpret requirements and available data to evaluate best way forward from financial and technical point of view.
* Support our business units in the acoustic area.

 **Your background**

  

* We are looking for Doctor or Master of Science in acoustics or similar experience.
* Experience from soundPLAN or similar acoustic modelling software is a merit.
* You can be fresh out of university or have long experience - we are interested in all kinds of people.
* Even though you have a degree in acoustics you also have a keen interest in, or understanding of, other areas like mechanics, climate, and electrical aspects in order to combine acoustic knowledge with the requirements on our delivery.
* Prior experience in any of the technical areas is beneficial but not a demand, your personality and interest are of high importance.
* As a person you are a positive, problem-solving individual with the attitude that everything is possible to do in a team. You will work in a team where being able to take responsibility and willingness to learn are key features.
* A general interest in technology is needed to be a good fit in this position. The goal is to have cost-effective solutions while fulfilling all requirements. Common sense and understanding of practical aspects is beneficial.
* You should ideally like working in a multicultural environment and be able to express yourself written and spoken in English.

 **What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

 **More about us**


Are you ready for a new exciting challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Welcome to apply now! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!


This position is based in Ludvika or Västerås

  

Recruiting Manager henrik.samuelsson@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. title: Cryo / Systems Engineer
description:
Cryogenic / Systems Engineer
  
Are you the engaged Cryogenic Engineer who will drive the next generation of SCALINQ's quantum hardware? You will together with the team develop the full cryogenic hardware lifecycle—from simulation to experimental testing. You'll solve complex challenges in low-temperature physics and provide the critical simulation feedback that shapes our technology roadmap. Join us to make a direct impact on the future of quantum technology!
  
  

**Required Skills:**  

Fundamental understanding of low-temperature physics and cryogenic systems.
  
Good experience with SolidWorks Thermal, COMSOL Multiphysics or a similar thermal simulation software.
  
Advanced skills in Python or MATLAB for data handling, analysis, and model automation.
  
Ability to participate in experimental testing towards verification of simulation.
  
Ability to use simulation results to guide hardware development.
  
Ability to troubleshoot system issues in collaboration with design and test teams.
  
Team player who initiates a collaborative environment.
  
A drive to stay updated on the latest advancements in relevant technologies and computational modeling techniques and applying solutions across fields.
  
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data clearly.
  
A M.S. in a relevant field (e.g., Physics, Materials Science, Electrical engineering, Mechanical Engineering) or equivalent experience in a technical simulation role.
  
  

**Preferable Skills (Good to Have):**  

Ability to design experiments towards verification of simulation results.
  
Practical, hands-on experience with cryogenic refrigerators.
  
Experience with CAD software (e.g., SolidWorks, Inventor, Ansys).
  
Familiarity with the challenges of integrating RF/microwave components in cryogenic environments.
  
**A startup mentality:** Thrives in a fast-paced growing environment, is adaptable to changing priorities, and takes initiative to solve problems
  
  

**About us:** SCALINQ is a prominent player in the growing field of quantum computing. Our core focus is the development of state-of-the-art cryogenic hardware. All our products are classified as enabling hardware and are vital for the overall performance of a quantum computer. This could be your opportunity to play a key role in unlocking the full potential of a new tech era while structuring the financial backbone of the company.
  
  

**The Team:** At SCALINQ, diversity and inclusion are at the core of who we are. Our greatest strength lies in the people who shape our company, each contributing their unique skills and perspectives. Together, we blend cutting-edge research expertise with traditional engineering practices to develop innovative and commercially viable solutions. Joining our team means being part of a dynamic environment where every contribution matters.
  
Be part of a dynamic environment where your ideas and contributions truly make a difference.
  
**What we offer:** At SCALINQ, you’ll join a fast-moving, multicultural team at the forefront of a cutting-edge industry. We offer healthcare benefits, continuous learning opportunities, and an inspiring, modern workspace built for collaboration and innovation.
  
This is a place where driven individuals thrive—where you’re empowered to grow, take initiative, and explore new directions, all while working toward shared goals. Here, you have the opportunity to be truly smart—to think critically, solve complex problems, and make a real impact. Whether you choose to specialize or broaden your expertise, you’ll have the freedom to shape your path and contribute to something bigger.
  
In a rapidly changing world, we move with purpose—and we’re looking for others who do too.
  
Ready to push boundaries with us? Let’s go!
  
**Join Us:** If you think it sounds like fun please, apply by sending your resume and a cover letter.
  
Mark your application with CRYO.
  
Let’s explore the quantum future together!

title: Environmental Engineer
description:
At Toyota Material Handling Europe, we create the technology that keeps the world moving. We are over 13,500 colleagues passionate about supporting companies of all sizes with todays and tomorrow's material handling challenges. Because we know that our business and our industry are essential and sometimes even critical for them, for daily life and society at large.
  
  

In our respective headquarters in Mjölby, Sweden, Willebroek, Belgium, in our Sales companies across Europe or in our factories in France, Italy and Sweden, you can be part of an extraordinary journey. And together, we will Move the world towards easy and sustainable.
  
The Position
  
We are now looking for an Environmental Engineer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for product-related sustainability compliance and performance and will play the role in supporting our team in implementing sustainable engineering practices.
  
  

You will guarantee the fulfilment of the Environmental Regulations and Sustainable TMHE (Toyota Material Handling Europe) business model across TMHE products. This includes developing and applying strategies, guidelines, and methods that enhance environmental performance, reduce environmental impact, and strengthen the environmental mindset within R&D.
  
In this role you will report to Bianca Ionesei, Environmental Design Supervisor.
  
Your Responsibility
  
Monitor and interpret relevant environmental regulations (e.g., REACH, WFD, ESPR, EUBR, CSRD/ESRS).
  
Ensure environmental compliance requirements are met within the organization (to above stated).
  
Support organization with compliance related questions across TMHE entities.
  
Support R&D in applying product sustainability and ecodesign principles according to established standards and methodologies.
  
Develop, implement, and maintain procedures and processes to improve environmental product performance.
  
Perform Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) studies on TMHE products using dedicated software tools and established methodologies (e.g., ISO 14040, ISO 14044, ISO 14067)
  
Measure, analyse, and report environmental performance based on LCA results and other environmental indicators.
  
  

Your Profile
  
University degree in Environmental Engineering or a related technical field.
  
Knowledge of relevant environmental laws, directives, and regulatory frameworks.
  
Experience in environmental data analysis and reporting, including interpretation and communication of results.
  
Familiar with Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) methodologies an advantage to know LCA software tools (e.g. LCA for Experts, SimaPro).
  
Strong ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary teams and collaborate with various stakeholders.
  
Practical, hands-on, and solution-oriented approach, combined with high integrity and comfort working with diverse groups of people.
  
Ability and willingness to work in a multicultural environment.
  
Availability to travel occasionally within Europe.
  
  

Our Offer
  
At Toyota Material Handling Europe, we're not just a global leader in a fast-paced industry - we are a team that values collaboration, growth and making a real impact for our customers. In our dynamic, diverse and international environment, we offer a workplace where you can truly thrive and bring your ideas to life. This position is based in Mjölby, Sweden with remote work options available up to two days a week.
  
  

We're committed to supporting you with an attractive benefits package, including a yearly bonus and flexible work arrangements that allow you to balance your personal and professional life. With clear goals and direction from senior leadership, you'll also find abundant opportunities for career growth and development within the company. Our organisational support ensures that you can maintain a healthy work-life balance while pursuing meaningful work that shapes the future of our industry.
  
  

Your application
  
Please submit your application in English no later than 8th of March, 2026. Applications only accepted through our recruitment system. We screen continuously, so do not miss out and send in your application today!
  
For more information about this position please contact; Patrik Schultzén, Talent Acquisition Specialist; Patrik.Schultzen@toyota-industries.eu.

title: Sommarjobb / Summer Job for ABB Robotics Test Automation Engineer
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.


This role sits within ABB's Robotics business, a leading global robotics company. We're entering an exciting new chapter as we’ve announced the plan for SoftBank Group to acquire ABB Robotics. SoftBank is a globally recognized technology group and investor/operator focused on AI, robotics, and next-generation computing. By joining us now, you’ll be part of a pioneering team shaping the future of robotics—working alongside world-class experts in a fast-moving, innovation-driven environment.


This Position reports to:


R&D Team Lead **Your role and responsibilities**

ABB Robotics R&D department is looking for a software-driven student to help develop and analyze automated tests to be run on our internal testing systems.

  

Tasks:


1. Adapt advanced test cases to be compatible with the test systems.

* Map software test cases to different test systems.
* Adapt test cases if they are not compatible with the test systems.
* Update test case demands if the test cases cannot be adapted with the test systems.
  

2. Update manual test cases to be executed automatically.

* Identify test cases that can be automated.
* Determine correct test conditions to run non-executable test cases.
 **Your Background**

* Basic knowledge of C++/C/C# is a must.
* Basic level of English knowledge is a must.
* Visual Studio and Git knowledge are a plus, but not mandatory.
* ABB Robotics systems knowledge is a plus, but not mandatory.
  

Additional information: 072-5450903


Period: June – August 2026


Location: Västerås


Work arrangement: On-site

 **What's in it for you?**We empower you to take initiative, challenge ideas, and lead with confidence. You’ll grow through meaningful work, continuous learning, and support that’s tailored to your goals. Every idea you share and every action you take contributes to something bigger. **More about us**

Recruiting Manager Johan Backlund, +46 72 545 09 03, will answer your questions.


Positions are filled continuously. Please apply with your CV, academic transcripts, and a cover letter in English.

  

We look forward to reading your application in PDF format. Last day to apply is 02/28. Please note that the interview process is ongoing, apply now to secure your spot in the recruitment process!

  

Please note that to be eligible for employment at ABB Sweden, you will need to pass our pre-employment screening steps. This includes a reference check, a drug test, and could also include an extended background check.

  

We kindly decline direct contact with staffing and recruitment agencies as well as sellers of additional job advertisements.

  

Join us. Be part of the team where progress happens, industries transform, and your work shapes the world. Run What Runs the World.


We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.

title: Project Completions Manager
description:
**Location:**

Ludvika, Dalarna County, Sweden
**Job ID:**

R0118765
**Date Posted:**

2026-02-19
**Company Name:**

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB
**Profession (Job Category):**

Quality Management
**Job Schedule:**

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**The Opportunity**

HVDC (High Voltage Direct Current) is a product group in Hitachi Energy, which develops, manufactures and sells DC transmission systems on a global market. HVDC technology is used to transmit electricity over long distances and for power transmission via submarine cables. It is also used to connect power systems.


We are now hiring a Completion Manager to HVDC Sweden, a business line within Hitachi Energy. As Completions Manager you have a key role in the project by being responsible to define and implement the Project Completion Strategy. You will have the opportunity to work both operational and strategic, as well as interacting with different internal and external stakeholders within the business.


We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even though you don’t meet all requirements. A team with great cooperation and with diverse backgrounds is waiting for you to join!


**How you’ll make an impact**

* Provide leadership, guidance and support in the projects to set up the completion strategy and ensure adherence to completion requirements based on the customer’s contract
* Lead, develop and sustain the completion processes within the project
* Identify the completion activities for the project and coordinate and manage the activities towards the time schedule and different contractual milestones
* Review, train and provide tool clarification on the project completion tool (PCS) to the organization and clarify interfaces
* Set up, govern and maintain inspection and resource plan for inspections at suppliers
* Set-up Project Completion System (PCS) and follow-up by defining the structure of the project by breaking down the scope in systems, subsystems, commissioning packages and mechanical completion packages as defined in the Project Completion Strategy

**Your background**

* Technical / Engineering / Quality management education – preferably bachelor’s degree
* Minimum 5+ years professional experience, and/or completion of at least one major project up to handover to the Customer, in a role related to the function within an EPC in Power, Energy or Oil & Gas project(s)
* Knowledge and experience of working with a Project Completions Systems (PCS) such as PIMS and ProCoSys, or alternatively another similar inspection management software e.g., BIM 360 Field, Aconex Field, etc.
* Proficient oral and written communication skills including technical documentation and reporting
* Sensitive to Customer and project team needs and can develop a sustainable relationship to all involved stakeholders through clear communication, influencing and coordination.
* English fluency (written + spoken)

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
